1112.content:
It was a cold night in the woods of Kanto. The trees shivered along with the fleshly things as the chilly breezes whistled by and nipped at it with icy fingers. The moon was being passed by gray clouds and misty vapors, and in the song of the air a Pidgeyl or Spearow could be heard joining in to the melody.

It had been a long day for Pokemon trainer Ash Ketchum and his friends. The battles they had been in with both Team Rocket and fellow trainers alike were tiring them out, and they needed a vacation from all the stress. Traveling through the woods they had come upon a lovely area of woods and forest land that would allow them a short cut to the next city, and for Ash, the next Kanto League Gym.

The humans and their Pokemon friends made camp around a brightly burning, courtesy of Ash’s Charizard. All of the Pokemon had been released from their confinments, including Brock’s assortment, so the three teens and their sixteen Pokemon friends encircled the fire and had a late-night supper. The food as normal was provided by Chef Brock, and tonight he had given them a special treat of sub sandwiches loaded with greens and white meat.

This dinner, however, Misty pinched off little bits of bread and lettuce from Pikachu's portion when he wasent looking , and the orange haired gym leader gulped them eagerly and greedily, sitting besides Ash's beloved Pokémon.

The yellow mouse Pokemon had been the first Ash ever acquired, and as such he was the most powerful in terms of level and experience to all of Ash’s team. He didn’t look that tough and was not horribly intimidating at a height of two feet with his cute shining black eyes, but beneath the fur and the long pointed ears he could power half a city with the voltage from his electric-charged cheeks.

Misty had always been...jealous of Pikachu in a way. While she was constantly at odds with Ash's stupidity to get closer to him, he and Pikachu were as thick as thrives. So, she had no qualms about stealing some pesky little mouse's food. After all, she was a growing girl, and she needed energy to support herself.

It was the greatest joy of Misty's life being with Ash and his Pokémon, though. There were few Persons on earth who could say to have the amazing adventures and experiences that Misty did. She had traveled the region, had seen amazing secrets of the Pokemon universe and even witnessed some of the rarest Pokemon ever to exist.

If only he wasn't so stupid. So annoying stupid. So naive about evreyone and always looking for the best in people and being so dang attractive.

Misty rubbed her stomach contentky, satisfied with the leader amount of food that was given to her. She had noticed that she had been eating more and more recently, in larger and larger portions. Her new eating habits had developed a slight pot belly, once rail thin, now had a sizable amount of pudge. But she didn't care, she was too annoyed with Ash and Pikachu to care.

Even now, they were laughing at a joke Brock Harland told in perfect unison, their chuckles being totally in sung with one another. On one hand, it warned Misty's heart to see such a living relationship between Pokémon and Himan, but on the other, it made her sick, because she was supposed to be the one laughing with Ash, not some stupid yellow rat. They were almost like brother's for pete's sake.

Sometimes she wished she would just eat him up so he would have to pay attention to her for a change.
1112.title: Misty

1121.content:

Well, I must say the staff members are surprisingly good at their jobs! I cleared out the entire buffet today for the first time (I’m so proud!) and they had it restocked in less than an hour. It’s much to my shame to admit that I was too full to continue and so retired from the dining hall to rest my poor, stretched belly. This cruise is probably the best gift I’ve ever been given. Who would have thought becoming the champion of Hoenn includes going on an all expanse free trip to Alola? I must have gained at least one hundred and fifty pounds since I set foot on deck and all I can say is, thank Arceus for the ship gift-shop! After the incident it’s good to know they have bikinis going up to 12x. No more public nudity for this gal! The S.S. Plenty is making a stop at one of the nearby islands to stock up and I assume they’ll bring on a little extra food just for little me!

11213.content:
Day Twelve

Oof! Well either this bedroom is shrinking or I’m getting bigger. I know the doorways are a little on the small side but my fat arse is struggling to get through! This morning after breakfast I managed to wedge myself firmly into the frame and it took two of those strong sailor boys to get me free. I thanked one of them personally later on today. Who wouldn’t a piece of all this though? Poor thing, I don’t think he expected such a challenge; having a six hundred and fifty pound land whale straddling your pelvis is probably a little rough and...well when she collapses the bed halfway through I can sort of see why you might want to visit the ship’s doctor afterwards. He was a real trooper though, managed to fight on through despite the fractured rib! I don’t doubt he’ll be back for more once he’s all healed up.

I’m really loving my new shape. The more I stuff myself the more rolls I find. My poor jeans are really struggling to keep back the tide of belly trapped within them and I don’t think my shirt has much more life left in it. It’s a little bit embarrassing to walk around and have everything slipping out left right and centre but at the same time the funny looks and whispering behind my back is kind of hot! I’m without doubt one of the largest living thing on this boat, human or otherwise, and I bet I’m at least as big as five of the skinny little girls that lounge about on the deck. I love how I can feel my body wobbling with every step and how out of breath I get just climbing a few stairs. My thighs are packed with cellulite and my boobs are so full and plump, Arceus knows what I’ll do when my bras give up the go. Maybe I’ll just go au naturel and let them sit loose under my shirt. Don’t want to give too many people nosebleeds though!

This afternoon I’ll probably head out for some more lunch and then waddle up topside for some sun bathing. Hopefully they’ve reinforced a few of the recliners—or at least widened them. I had to use one for each arse cheek last time...
11213.title: Day 12

112131.content:
Day Thirteen

Oh gosh, disaster strikes! I was minding my own business yesterday on three (so what if I had a big lunch!?) of those deck chairs when a few sorority girls came past me. The group was nattering away and giggling and of course once they saw me, well that was it for peace and tranquility! I’ve been called a whale before, it’s hardly inventive or new but when you’re called it over and over again it can rub you the wrong way. Now, I’m a fairly passive girl by nature! I don’t like conflict but when someone upsets me enough I will take action. Yesterday was one such instance where I could not sit idly by and just let them laugh at my expense.

It didn’t take too long to get my own back; after lounging about the poolside for a while they eased themselves into the water and made a beeline for the centre, where it was deepest. As they trod water and tittered I hauled my enormous self up out of my recliners and waddled awkwardly towards the diving platform. It must have been such a sight; my enormous body jiggling and wobbling as I hauled myself up the ladder, each run groaning uncontrollably under my big, fat hands. My bikini bottom kept easing itself down my derriere until the skin-tight band was resting at the base of my thighs, the entirety of my almighty, dimpled posterior on show to the world. After much huffing and puffing, I managed to make it to the top and was rewarded for my tenacity with the spectacle of my prey far below. It was only until one of them looked up and pointed at the colossal, sun-blocking monster above her that I made my move.

To be honest things didn’t pan out exactly how I had wanted them too. My plan was to dive into the pool and wash them out on the back of a tidal wave. Six pissed off college girls and one enormous husky in a wet t-shirt, everyone wins. Unfortunately, as I stepped onto the diving platform I didn’t even get a chance to bounce once before it snapped under me. When a near-seven hundred pound blob of lard falls twenty five feet onto a couple of ninety pound jackal girls, the outcome is pretty much predetermined. The first girl was lucky enough to catch a glancing blow with my gut and although she was trapped underneath my massive belly rolls, she probably would have been all right had she not knocked her head against the floor of the pool and knocked herself out. The second chick had even worse luck. Instead of colliding with my butt cheeks or my thighs she stood, pencil straight and stared up at the oncoming bringer of her annihilation. It all happened in the space of a second but I felt a sudden insertion into my sphincter and then up she went, straight into my rectum. It felt so good that my primal urges immediately took hold and although I probably could have squeezed her back out I decided instead to pull her up, up and hold her until she stopped struggling. She would do well to digest inside me but I was so turned on by this point I wanted to do more damage! I wanted to feel the pointless resistance of those skinny little things turn to nothing under the elephantine expanse of my blubbery body. I picked up my gut and heaved it above the girl who was desperately panicking, trying to relieve herself and return to the surface for air. Just as she thought she was free I brought it back down and eased myself forwards; rolling on top of her like an unstoppable boulder. It didn’t take long for her to cease fighting and then...I ate her. I couldn’t help myself but as I drew closer and closer to orgasm I felt the uncontrollable urge to consume her, to have her drop into my gut, to feel another living creature turn to fat and swaddle me with ever more lard.

A little accident became a frenzy and by the time the waves had subsided and the pool water had mostly been displaced over the edge of the deck and into the sea there was no one left in that empty vessel but me: an incredibly satisfied Hoenn champion my gut bulging and gurgling without respite as I ran my chubby hands over my rolls, moaning as I gushed between my two enormous thighs, a puddle of my liquids leaking out from underneath me. Of course the issue now is what if I was seen! I shall have to plan what to do next and how best to proceed. No one can know what I’ve done; what if they turn the ship around and cuff me? I can’t let that happen
112131.title: Day 13

Putting them away inside of me was fairly easy; the boys just got a blow job each and I made sure to gobble them up just before they came. Greninja sighed as he watched the last few Pokémon get picked by their new trainers. He frowned a bit in envy and countinyed to eat his food.

Greninja was one of the first Pokémon to live with Prof. Augustine Sycamore. Back then he was just a Frokie, youthful and full of energy. He used to dream of getting picked by a trainer and travel around Kalos and making friends. But back then, nobody wanted a crooks as their Pokémon. He was called a bunch of nasty names, ugly, disgusting, a waste of space.

The most heart wrenching and ironic part about this tale is by the time trainers started picking Frokie gain, he had already evolved into frogaider.

It was illegal for a trainer to have a 2nd evolution as a starter Pokémon, which meant that he was deadlines to stay at Peof. Sycamore's lab. Forever.

Greninja sighed again and pushed away his now empty bowl of food. He tried to think of less depressing matters. It wasent all bad living here. The Professor was nice and treated him with respect, and he never had to worry about fighting over a meal. He even learned how to speak human over the years, with help from Sycamore of coarse. But human language wasent the only thing he gained...

Greninja rubbed his stomach with his webbed hand. Years of free food and a bit of laziness has led to a slight layer of fat around his normally thin form. He wasent fat per se, just more...plump then regular Greninja's. His once lithe belly had just a tiny more jiggle to it, just enough to be noticeable. His arms and legs were a tad thicker too, even his face behind his tongue felt heavier.

But he didn't mind. He knew he could work off the pounds with no effort at all, he just didn't feel like it. Greninja riding really see the pudge as a big deal. All of his stats were the same, he still fought the same way. In fact, he might dare say his ways were going up. Just last week, Prof. Sycamore told him that his defense and hp increased, which is weird, because he hadn't done any trading that week.

Finnaly, Greninja pushed himself away from the table and glistened himself off of the chair. There wa no use in just sitting around all day.

He desided to...

124331.content:
My name is the Inspector. My real name is not important, nor do people call me by it anymore, just Inspector. To many people, for better or worse, they know me as the man who sat behind the desk at the Grestin Border checkpoint. Sometimes i hold their lives in my hands, other times i risk letting terrorists through. Whatever choice i make, however, i more often than not feel as if i made the wrong one.

Today is March 7th, 1983. It has been two months since the border reopened after the failed terrorist attack by EZIC. Like so many other junctures in my life since i had been selected by the labor lottery, i was once again unsure if i had made the right choice.

I could have helped Ezic with their goals, they made themselves apparent enough. But i ignored everything they had ever said. I could escaped to snowier pastures, live a new life with my family in Obristan. But instead of risking their lives by leaving home to a strange and unfamiliar place, i risked their lives by staying in a corrupt dictatorship.

Thankfully, it seemed that even if i did not make the right choice, i had at least won the game. I had been loyal to Arstotzka, and i have been rewarded for it. I live in a Class 5 Apartment with my family, something many people can not say they have. For the first time in my life we actually had living room to spare. My tiny booth prominently displayed three gold plaques that showed my loyalty. In the eyes of my superiors, i was the perfect model of a citizen.

But today, as i wavd to serigu as i walked to my booth, i knew immediately there was something wrong. I couldn't hear the usual murmur of voices and feet shuffling over the concrete wall.

“Eh?” i questioned to no one in particular. I soon chocked it up to immigrant weirdness and continued my jot. I opened the second door to the left to reveal my sad, and i do mean sad, office. It’s amenities included: A chair, desk, and two guns. Yay.

I sat down in my uncomfortable metal stool and prepared myself for the endless line of immigrants coming through. After throwing away (Yet another) Pink vice card a poor girl gave me, i cleared my throat and spoke loud into the microphone.

“Next!”

“…”

“…”

“…Next?”
124331.title: Paper's Please?

1243311.content:
I waited, maybe for 2 minutes before i called into the speaker again, this time louder.

“NEXT!”

But still no one came. At this point i was very, very confused. This had never happened before, the immigrants were supposed to flood in at the start of 6:00 A.M. But it was 6:02 A.M, and no one had come into the booth. I waited four more minutes, just to be safe.

After 6 minutes of waiting, I...i decided to do something that i really never done before. What no one has done before really. I slipped out of my office and opened the entry door that leads to Kolechia. The guards looked stunned, but i did not pay them any attention.

It’s illegal for people to actually leave Arstotzka, that’s why the booth only has people on the Kolechian side, because once you come, they don’t let you leave. But i wasn't REALLY crossing over, i was just informing myself as to why the immigrants weren't coming. But it never occurred to me the real reason why...until i opened the entry door.

I never would have thought that there just wouldn't be anybody.

I looked around the barren, grey waiting area, unusually devoid of life. No hoards of immigrants converging on my one, tiny booth. I stood with my mouth agape in the doorway, not moving, before my senses overcame me and i shut the door hastily. After a lapse of judgement, i remembered the daily bulletin. I rushed back to the inspector’s side of the the booth in a flurry, earning more puzzled glances from the guards. I sat down on my uncomfortable stool and pulled the bulletin out of it's slot.

“Inspector,

The leaders of the Unified Republic of Hibernia have been summoned for diplomatic discussions on their new admittance to the council of nations in Paradizna. Your map has been Hibernia in the rulebook. Do NOT make any mistakes in the inspection of their papers, or you will suffer heavy penalties. All non-diplomatically authorized immigrants will be travelling through the newly opened Nirsk checkpoint at the seaside. Detain all Non-Diplomats.

Glory to Arstotzka.”

My initial confusion revolving around the absence of people coming today was now replaced with newfound confusion. I had never heard of the country of this ‘Hibernia’ before. I always knew there were more countries in the world then just the ones in the Seven Members Forum, but my teachers only ever talked about them when I was a child.

Curious, i opened my rulebook and turned to the Map page. Hibernia, from what I gathered, was an island nation in the sea south of Arstotzka and east of Impor and Kolechia. It was pretty far away from the mainland, and I gathered that's why i never hear of it until now.

I composed myself and re-organized my punitive desk. I sat impatiently, fiidting my fingers as i waited for the mysterious diplomats to arrive. As i waited, I lamented, spurred by the remembering of my old school, my childhood growing up in Nirsk.

Shithole, as I had once described to Serigu, was putting the city nicely. The sea bellowed harsh and unforgiving winds, cold and icy and laced sorrow voices that sighed all night long. The populace decided to combat this cold with a city-wide drinking campaign, putting all their money into booze and alcohol so that they may shut the doors on the wintry climate. Nisk was a city of drunkards and alcoholics, who, like my father, struggled to suppress that agonizing pain and misery that rang in everyone's heads.

Whatever made the M.O.A think that it would be a good place to set up a checkpoint?

My thoughts were interrupted by a sudden rasping at the door, and i found myself rather flustered. I seized the microphone and spoke into it with authority. “Next!”.

And i swear to you , after most likely thousands of entrants processed, after thousands more stamps given, I truly thought I could not be surprised by this job anymore than it already has. So as the entrant rose up to the elevated platform inside, I thought that, even though today had started off strange, there would be nothing too different from this diplomat then all the hundreds of them I had already processed. Then, it's shadow reveled it.

And I almost screamed bloody murder.

Who's that Pokemon?
1243311.title: Countinue this Story

choices: Snorlax is starting to get impatient
Snorlax tries to make some room
12433112.content:
Or, I would have, had my mouth not been filled to the brim with beige, furry flesh. The shadow revealed itself, and no sooner than it did, my vision was obscured as a soft and warm sphere engulfed me and sent me flying. My body was flung back into the flimsy wood wall by the sheer force, enough to make it conform around my body slightly. The entire booth seemed to heave and moan and shake violently.

I waived my arms aimlessly around the spherical protrusion before lifting my body against the battered wall to inch up past it. As i finally wiggled my way out of the confinement, i found out two things. One, the blob of yellowish fur, which were as soft a bed but heavy like a ton of bricks, were a stomach. Second, the owner of this stomach belonged to bear. Or at least what was similar of a bear.

It, or really I mean she considering her rather plump breasts, was absolutely huge, in both height and width. Her head pushed through the ceiling of the booth, making it impossible to identify her height. She had this fur, this actual fur on her body: dark blue on her sides and presumably back with a cream tint on her chubby face and belly, which was currently pushing it’s way into the inspector’s window and crushing my desk. And me. Her eyes, i couldn't see, because they were squinted to the point that they were lines.

Her head was abnormally huge, only made bigger by her puffed up cheeks laced with lipids, and had two small, but pointy teeth protruding from her lower jaw. My eyes briefly glanced over to the inbuilt weight scale before turning my eyes back to the creature. I was horrified that it said in bold letters, ‘ERROR’. The bear like creature gave me a smirk and giggled a very feminine giggle, making her whole body, along with her gut that i was still pinned by, quivering. “Oops. Sorry Mr. Inspector, I think I might have put on a few pounds.” she gave me a flirty wink and patted her stomach like it was a prized pet.

My cheeks reddened and found that my heart rate increased. I shook my head, with some difficulty, and struggled to compose myself. “P-p-p-papers, please.” I stuttered meekly, with about as much authority as a 6 year old selling lemonade. The bear creature beamed at me. “Oh, I have them right here! Almost forgot about them! Haha!” She laughed. She reached from behind her back and produced her papers on the top of her stomach. I didn't want to know where a naked animal would be carrying things around, and i regret that i ever found out later.

“Miss, I can’t inspect your papers in this...er...particular fashion.” I said as I grabbed her passport and other documents from ontop of her protruding tummy. She maintained her happy demeanor and smile and laughed another hearty bellow. “Haha! Yeah that does seem like a problem doesn't it? Hey, tell you what. How about you just stamp my passport with a nice big, shiny green checkmark, and I’ll be on my way?”

“...”

“...No?”

“No.”

“Awww come on! I can’t stay here for long! Don’t get me wrong I love your company.” The way she said love made me feel uneasy, for i was oddly genuine and held no sign of sarcasm whatsoever. “But I have to attend this big party in a crappy town called “Paradisney”, and people are gonna get md if I don’t show up.”

“It’s pronounced Paradizna, and It's the capital of Arstotzka.”

“Oh...um...sorry?”

“Don’t be.” I said, stealing myself a little smile, which was becoming more and more rare these days, “The way you described it is considered a compliment.”

The sun hangs low over the region of Johto, shining brightly in the sky. The yellow ball of light illuminated the tops of leaves and buildings with it’s life giving force, just as it has done for hundreds of years, and will continue to do so for hundreds more.

The sun's rays were especially lazy today. Meaning, the warmth that the the star provided was just so perfect, just the perfect mix between scorching hot and cold, making the inhabitants of the region to mull about there day, tired, content, and sluggish.

Yes it was a peaceful and serene day in Johto...

...it wouldn't stay like that forever though.

Deep within Ilex Forest, Pokemon pranced and played around underneath the cool shade of the canopies. Beedrills sucked at the flowers, woopers splashed by the water, it was a truly carefree day.

Suddenly, the ground underneath their feet began to shake. It was a soft tremor at first, but as time went on it became more and more violent. It Seemed like Groudon itself was paying the forest a visit. The forest trees shook and swayed like toothpicks as the earthquake continued to rage on.
And then, it stopped. The Pokemon looked around quizzingly. The forest had sustained extensive damage, but it was nothing that they couldn't fix. What really surprised them was the fact that the last time an earthquake was in Johto, the world was still be formed, What could have caused it?

Celebi awoke from her slumber, taking a nap on his very lazy day, and flew out of her forest shrine. The Pokemon all asked her questions on what was going on, but she could not answer them. Ilex forest wasn't supposed to get an earthquake for another 300 years.

Unknownst to them, deep within another part of the forest, there lies the source of the giant quake. A giant plume of dust billowed out from a once clean and grassy field. From outside the cloud, one could scarcely see a silhouette of something, but it was too dark to make out exactly what. Whatever it was, it was big.

The dust soon evaporated from the air and revealed the silhouette. “Mmmmm...Yaaaaaaaaaawnnnn~” A feminine voice moaned blissfully.

In a large crater where the dust supposedly came from, was a Snorlax. However, there was some key differences between the Snorlax here and a regular Snorlax. This Snorlax, for one, was not 6.11 but 10.5, making it gargantuan eve for it’s own species. And by it, i mean her, as this Snorlax is clearly a woman, bearing certain lady parts most Pokemon don’t sport.

But the most obvious thing one would notice about this Snorlax was that it was f at. Not Snorlax fat, Guzzlord fat. She weighed exactly double a Snorlax is supposed to weigh, and carried it all in her feminine curves. Her cream furred belly jutted out from her and sagged down her crotch, obscuring her womanhood. It jiggled and quivered as the wind lightly kissed after years of being kep still underneath the Earth. On top of her stomach were breasts that beyond any breast size. They were as big as a heavy load pick-up truck and partially obscured her vision from it’s girth.

The Snorlax’s thunder thighs and hip endlessly sloshed and bobbed as adipose and lipids blorped inside. They only helped make her ass even more huge than it already was, a staggering size that would need a couch for each cheek.

The SNorlax lady rested her pudgy arm on her gut, making it bounce like a trampoline. She rubbed it and groaned with pleasure. It has been centuries since she had felt her precious body again. She had been sleeping underneath the ground for a good deal of time, ever since she was trapped by those pesky humans. She smirked at the thought, she looked back on the event with joy.

“I can’t believe those stupid apes locked me underground JUST because i destroyed their entire civilization.” the Snorlax frowned a tad, “I mean, it’s not like i was in the wrong. A big girl like me needs to eat, and their cutesy wutesy wittle village looked sooo good.” She licked her lips, remembering her past feast.

“What was it called again? Flalf? Alphy?...eh, doesn't matter, it’s long gone now.” The giant female Pokemon shrugged her shoulders casually. She looked down at herself and gasped in surprise. All those yeras of sleep had managed her to actually LOSE weight? She remembered her old self, her towering body as big as a mountain, burping and gorging the land away. How long has she been under? Suddenly, her stomach brought ter out of her thought by gurgling expectantly.
“...Speaking of food...” The snorlax started to stand up, completely unaffected by her waist size,”I think it’s time for a little breakfast~”.

She began to walk her heavy body around, heavy footfalls quaking the earth around her, leaving behind a fat footprint. She only walked a couple of steps before reaching her destination. She stopped in front f the tree line that surrounded the clearing. Thick trees wrapped around the patch of now abrte dirt, almost trying to keep her from leaving so she wouldn't spread her gluttony to other parts of the forest.

The Snorlax smiled at the foolish display the plant was making, a promptly took a bite out of it’s branch. She chewed the bark and leaves around her mouth slowly, savoring the surprising amount of taste a tree can offer, before swallowing it whole. She grinned happily, and quickly took another bite out of the tree, this time bigger. Then she took another...

...and another..

...and another...

Until there was nothing left but the stump. She smiled and patted her flabby middle, now fully engorged as the tree inside her started to digest. Almost instantly, she felt the sorry excuse for a plant melt away, adding poundage to her frame. She shot up another foot, and her entire body got even more fat, and more squishy.
“Mmmmm...” The snorlax loved the feeling of fat being poured onto her frame. It was like receiving a big hug from her! She was reminded of her glory years when she was really something to behold.

She was a special type of breed of Snorlax, a sort of evolution for the species. Munchlax's like to eat, Snorlax's like to sleep, but her...

She giggled as she remembered the nickname her parents gave her when she evolved so many years ago. They called her “Fatlax:, because all she ever did was want to get bigger and fatter. “Fatlax” was a rare evolution that only occurred in Female snorlax's af full stats on every level. She went to work immediately after she evolved, eating all day and all night. When her brothers said to leave some food for them, she just ate them too.

Fatlax unconsciously started to munch on another tree while she was in thought. She never could not be eating food, it was against her nature. She leans against the tree and it almost instantly gets pushed out of the ground into the other trees. She rested her big hip on it, erupting a series of snaps and groans from the piece of timber, but it fell on deaf ears.

Meanwhile, back with Celebi, she heard the telltale signs of tree destruction coming from one of her favorite parts of the forest. She glared her eyes and zoomed pass the foliage a she neared the site of the sound.

Celebi soon stopped in front of Fatlax’s massive gut, standing (In mid Air) agape as she eyed the creature with amazement. She saw her massive form crash itself into one of her trees and she got angry instantly.

“Hey!” She said with surprising booming voice. “What do you think you're doing?!”

Fatlax broke out of her train of thought and lowered her head down to see who was calling her, only to find her wrecking ball boobs blocked the way. LAughing, she parted them, revealing a rather irate forest guardian.

“Oh~!” Fatlax clapped her hands together, making bosom shake with glee. “Aren't you a little cutie! What your name little girl?” She asked in the most demeaning baby talk Celebi ever heard. How she never heard of her before is beyond her mind, but she was to mad to care at the moment.

“My name is Celebi, and you are crushing my trees!” she fumed, her face red with anger. “I take special care into ensuring the safety of this forest and--DID YOU EAT ONE OF THEM!” She screeched as she saw the empty stump of where a tree once was.

“Yeah, i did. Heh, pretty tasty too!” she slapped her tummy affectionately. “You-you-you're a monster!” Celebi stuttered.

“Huh. That’s funny. That’s what the humans called me too before they locked me underneath this place. Now...” Fatlax moved her fat clawes towards Celebi. “Why don’t you give Mama Fatlax a hug?”.
“Waht?! No! I'm not hugging you i'm furious with--Ooof!”Celebi was cut off as she was grasped by Fatlax’s hand. She brought her frail body to her massive rack, pressing her into the soft boobage.

“Mmmmm...that’s right little cutie~. Squirm for Momma.” She teased wickedly as Celebi struggled against her fat. She puncehd and kicked by was powerless to do anything against her. She stopped as she heard the ominous growling of Fatlax’s flabby belly. She looked up to see Fatlax’s face, darkened by the shadow the sun casted as it hanged in the sky above.

“Now give Momma a kiss...” Fatlax breathed as she brought the helpless legendary Pokemon who really should have used her time traveling powers at this point to her lips for a ‘kiss’.
1243312.title: More and More of Her

12433121.content:
But it wasn't a kiss she received. The lips parted to reveal her gaping maw, anxiously awaiting the arrival. Celebi started in horror, but before she could even flinch in protest she was dropped into Fatlax’s maw, and her lips closed shit, silencing any chance at escape.

She swished her tongue around Celebi’s body, revelling in her taste as she was helplessly flung around the Snorlax’s mouth. She tied to hang on to her tongue, but it was to slick to latch on to.

Fatlax leaned her head back and let the small legendary fall to the back of her mouth, catching her in her esophagus. The fleshy tube wormed it's way around Celebi, who in returned struggled violently to get out. But it was far too late.

Fatlax traced the lump on her throat as it disappeared past her chest. It had been so long since she had eaten a something live. It was truly delicious. The throat muscles pushed Celebi all the way down her body until she was safely deposited in her soft stomach completely devoid of acid where she would rest until Fatlax let her out.

Just Kidding. :)

Fatlax sighed as she felt the new wave of aft hu=it her body. It wa barely noticeable to the naked eye, but she felt it, which was enough for her. She never really got that cute little Pokemon’s name. Oh wait she did! What was it again? Celly?

Meh.

She sauntered off into the forest, happily eating trees along the way, hoping that one day she will come back to her old size and that there would be lots and lots of food in her future.

-----------------------------------

Fatlax's thick, wide, fuzzy paws crashed unforgivingly into the forest floor as she lazily sauntered around the vegetation, casually eating bits and pieces of Celebi's former forest. She always enjoyed taking time with her meals, sure she could easily mow the whole place down in an hour, but then all the flavour would be fire or lost, and no matter how many tree's she eats, she always ends up finding a new flavor.

Suddenly, Fatlax saw something that wasent apart of the usual forest foliage. Looking over her incredibly large dome of a stomach, she spied a human village nestled quite snugly around a sea of trees.

"Ooh, humans! It looks like they got a little bit more smart, but they still pick the stupidest places to build their homes. Why would you build a town inside a forest?" Fatlax spoke to herself.

There was something...different about this town though. Something that made Fatlax stare down at it longer then she realized. Sure, there was the usual aura of a uneaten feast in their like usual, but there was just something...different in their as well. An emotion that wasn't just hunger or gluttony was rare for her to feel. The last time that she felt anything else was when she was still (relatively) little and living with her family.

Her dad helped her catch her first meal, a nice fat, juicy Luxray. It made her feel...love. Until she ate them all. Fatlax just felt that there was something in there for her to see that wasent food. With a smile, Fatlax easily trampled down shrubbery as she strolled out of the endless sea of green canopy into the human town.

-------------------

"Mmmmh..."

It was just like any other morning for Charles, the sun shining into his face as he tried to blanket himself from the light, the smell of the lean, healthy foods floating around his room from the kitchen down below, and the ringing alarm clock to the side of her bed (usually by now thrown against the wall).
Normally the brown haired boy would just dive back to sleep on this muggy summer morning. But today was different...

Today was the day that the famous Poke ball maker, Kurt, wanted to talk to him, so forcing himself from the bed, Charles slowly headed to the bathroom to try to wake himself up...

After a quick splash of water, Charles looked in the mirror and saw the same face he saw every time he looked in a mirror. He blinks his dilapidated, powder blue eyes and stretches his arms out in front of himself in an attempt to push out the sleepiness. It was saturday, a lazy saturday too. The pidgey outside his window are chirping contently, the sun filtering into the room brightly, but not too brightly. It was a perfect day in Azalea town to just stay in bed. But for Charles, he knew that he was going to have to fight off those urges.

Charles leisurely walked to his dresser and assembled his attire for the day. Walking into the hall outside his bedroom, he once again is treated to the pleasant smells of cooked food emanating from the kitchen below, and he can hear the footsteps of his father as he walks about preparing them breakfast. Charles's father had always liked cooking, as long as Charles remembers. He had always hypothesized that he had a love for the practice, or at least he came to that conclusion after seeing the rather under-class food other people had been eating around the town in his school days.

Charles walked down the stairs and entered the kitchen as eagerly as he could considering he was still exercising off the remnants of sleep from his frame. Upon hearing Charles enter, his father turned his head to see him and smiled warmly

“Oh, hello, my boy! You are just in time to eat breakfast. I found this new recipe yesterday and I wanted to try it out. You would not believe how many sticks of butter there is in this!” he smiled, hoisting the tray up from the oven. He walked over to the kitchen table and sets the dish on it. He and Charles both sat down at the same time. Charles’s father looked eagerly at his son, hoping that he was impressed with his newest culinary creation.

Charles looked down curiously at the monumental amount of food his father had set before him. “What was the name of that new recipe of your, Dad?”

“Oh, It was the...” Charles’s father pondered for moment before taking out a piece of folded up paper from his pocket. “...the heart-attack snack.”.

Charles could see how it got it’s name. The thing looked to be some kind of bacon-sausage casserole thing, and true to his father’s word, the whole thing was glistening with butter, not to mention it sat in a pool of the stuff, had it slathered on top and in between every layer, and it looked like several layers were just made of deep fried butter if they weren't mistaken. It also looked like it incorporated three full grown pigs' worth of bacon, and two more in sausage. There were other ingredients holding it all together, but Charles couldn't identify them as easily. But he knew this thing could probably clog a Wailord’s arteries.

Charles took a slice from the tray, a rather large slice by his standards, but it didn’t make a dent in the meal as a whole. After taking one bite, he was overwhelmed by it’s taste. It sat in his stomach like a brick. It was the greasiest, fattiest, most decadent meal he had ever experienced. And he was determined not to take another bite, less he go into a caloric coma.

Charles’s father took a bite out of his share and too became full after just the one. His face almost looked pale, as if he was stuffed to the brim.

“Ahh...that was...” Charles’s father began to say, “...not meant for humans...”

“Dad, where did you find that recipe, anyways?” Charles asked, feeling that he had a right to ask how anyone could print such a disaster's instructions on paper.

“I found It torn off from some book on the floor of the back of a bus.”

“...why were you looking at the floor of the back of a bus? You don’t even ride the bus.”

“Because I like to see what people left behind at the end of the day, before the bus driver has a chance to kick me off. One time I found a week old, half-eaten hamburger. Gross.”

Charles refrained from retorting back and began to help put the leftovers away. The casserole needed it’s own entire shelf in the fridge. Charles noticed that his father was visibly disappointed with how his latest dish turned out. He must have accidentally picked up a random recipe from a cookbook for Snorlax.

Speaking of Snorlax's however...how is ours fairing as of now?

1243322.title: How about Lucario?

choices: Without warning, its stomach expanded rapidly
Soon, a great hunger overtook him
12433221.content:
My eyes fluttered open as the rays of sunlight spilled into my tent. I felt something soft and furry against my head and lay confused for a moment. Untill I realised it was simply Lucario's chest. Upon realising this I snuggled closer into the warmth causing him to stir and wrapping his arms around me.

"Finally awake huh?" He asked.

"What do you mean finally? I always get up at a reasonable time" I reply with giggle. I look up at him smiling.

"Do you seriously call 1:00pm reasonable?"

Well excuse me early bird but I need my beauty sleep" I reply with a smirk.

"Well that is true, you need lots of it"

I fake a gasp "rude". We both laugh and I wiggle out of Lucario's grasp to get dressed.

"So did you have a good sleep?" I ask pulling on a pair of black skinny jeans.

"Yup pretty good, had an odd dream though"

"Oh yeah? What about?" I reply slipping on a loose grey t-shirt. The t-shirt bearing the Pokeball logo To alert people that I was Pokemon Trainer.

He walked up behind me and wrapped his arms around my waist with his head on my shoulder. I put on my glasses as I blush and look away. "Food." He replied simply, his long and slender tongue slithered out from between his muzzle, licking my cherk cutely as he did.

"Y-yeah...I wonder w-why" I reply sarcastically.

"Mmm~tasty" Lucario purred. He brought his arms around my chest and pulled me tighter, nuzzling my head affectionately. This only made me blush harder.

"Come on." I say, relinquishing my self from my treasured Pokemon's grasp. "We gotta get ready for the tournament."

"Awww already?" Lucario pouted. He puffed out his cheeks and folded his arms over his chest, making him look adorable on accident. "I wanted more time to cuddle. Five more minutes?"

"Oh alright." I say, giving into Lucario pout, "you know I can't say no to that face."

Time Passes...

"And it’s a beautiful day, ladies and gentlemen, for a Pokkén tournament! With all the excitement building, we now stand in the finals match to see who will take home the title of Pokkén Master! And it looks like there is some stiff competition for that title!”

“Oh yes Kiev, some stiff competition indeed. While we all expected the local heavyweight Charizard to Rock Smash his way to the top, I’ll bet no one expected his challenger to get anywhere up this mountain!”

“Too right Rick! No one ever expected that this particular Lucario would trump all of its competition to reach the finals match, and I gotta say, it pulled off some impressive feats to beat everything that stood in its way. I’m actually a little concerned for the Charizard, as its throne might not be as secure as its trainer thinks"

“We’ll have to see, as this match is about to begin!”

In the Ferrum Stadium, the competitors were preparing to face off in epic combat. The sky was cloudless for this match, and the sparkling waterfall acted as the perfect background for the battle of flame. On the left Charizard, on the right our lovable Lucario. The orange dragon grinned cockily at its diminutive opponent, his trembling paw holding onto my hand. “Cute that you got this far runt, but this is where your luck runs OUT!” the Charizard boasted while grinding its fist into its claw.

The relatively small Jackal trembled nervously, but it kept its stance bravely despite its nerves trying to get the better of it. “It wasn’t luck you overgrown lizard! I’ll beat you down like the Gengar and Braxien who looked down at me!” he retorted with a quivering voice.

"HA! Luck’s luck runt, and I’ll prove it by beating ya in this match!” the Charizard vowed.

Roaring loudly, Charizard took the advantage with an early Fire Punch, his bulk sailing through the air with a flaming fist. Lucario nimbly dodging out of the way, the dragon swapped into its flying stance, his mighty wings catching the air as he spiralled around. Right fist glowing with energy, he prepared to unleash a Dragon Claw as he dive bombed the jackal. Swivelling his wrist, Lucario unleashed a devastating Aura Punch attack, the tornado of blue flames knocking the lizard to the ground hard. “OOOOO! CHARIZRD JUST TOOK A HARD FALL! THAT WAS A NICE COUNTER FROM LUCARIO!"

Grunting loudly, Charizard recovered from his tumble, just in time to avoid a kick fromicario. Snarling lividly, the dragon’s burning rage became an inferno from the smug grin the anthropomorphic Jackal Pokémon had. “Better, urgh, better wipe that smug grin off your face. You got a lucky hit, but now the kiddy claws are off" Charizard snarled

“<I TOLD YOU!>” Lucario snapped in annoyance, “<it’s not luck, it’s skill and training. Though it’s not like a brute like yourself would understand that"

The smug little creature copped a fireball for that remarked, its lithe frame sliding along the hard ground. Grunting hard, its eyes opened only for its body to get grabbed hard by Charizard. Spiralling into the air, they immediately dropped from the air, ending in a devastating Seismic Toss attack. Lucario wheezed loudly from the impact, its body left in a cracked crater as it desperately tried to refill its lungs with air. “<Okay...,>” he groaned weakly, “<maybe there is something to brute force>” he admitted begrudgingly

This wasn’t looking too good. While it would be good at countering, Charizard had easily more strength and vitality than it did; and without support Pokémon, it was very likely that he was going to lose. “HA HA HA!"

Oh come ON! That was just unsportsmanlike. Charizard was laughing hard at him as he managed to drag his body from the crater. “Urgh...” Braixen groaned, its left leg shaking. This was bad, his leg was hurt, and there was no way it could hope to win like this. As much as it didn’t want to, it was going to have to resort to his trainer's...medicine to win this one. Breathing calmly, the Jackal grasped an orange bottle of pills that was hiding in his chest fur. Moving its top carefully, it opened and revealed his trainers special medicine: Two pills, as small as peas, but with powerful effects. Slowly, Lucario downed the two pills, sinking down into his stomach.

141111.title: Mew Duo

choices: Mew Starts to Put on the Pounds
1411111.content:
Thick, wide, fuzzy paws floated in the air as Mew lazily floated around the sky. She always
enjoyed exploring the Earth, and no matter how many times she circles around it, she always
ends up finding something new. Looking over her rather large feet she spied a human village
nestled quite snugly around a sea of trees. Humans seemed to find the strangest places to
live, Mew thought to herself.

There was something...different about this town though. Something that made Mew stare down
at it longer then she realized. Mew could sense there was something, or someone, down there
that she wanted to see. She just didn't know it yet. It was not uncommon for her to feel this way
about things. She felt the same way about the first time meeting her friend Mewtwo at his home,
she just felt that there was something in there for her to see. With a smile, Mew easily floated
down from the sky into the endless see of green foliage.

So it was, Mew perched herself on one of the many red shingled roofs of the modestly sized
hamlet. Burr. It was nippy out. It was the last few days of autumn. It wasn't good enough for
snow to fall, but almost.

"So, what's your favorite Pokémon?" Mew heard down below. Mew peered down the roof and
saw two boys converse among themselves. "Me?" The other boy responded, "Well...there are
just so many! How can you choose just one?" Mew smiled, she liked this boy.

"Well...just spit out the first one that you think of!" The boy impatiently inquired. The sentence
was so abrupt and snappy that it made the other boy recoil.


"Uhh...Mew..."

"Mew huh? Why? There's no way you'll ever catch one, you're too weak. You're not even a trainer."

"Why are you being so mean? I don't even want to be a trainer."

"That's stupid. Everyone wants to be a Pokémon trainer."

"Well, I don't. I don't like making Pokémon fight each other."

"Bah! You're a lost cause!" The boy retorted in a snarky way. Mew glared at the rude youth, he
was arrogant and had a smart mouth, and obviously doesn't understand how to make friends.
The other kid, however…

Mew looked around the landscape of the town. It was very small by human standards, but it had
a quaint sense of coziness around it. Humans were good at making beautiful things...when they
wanted at least. She could see why that some Pokémon might resent humans for what they
have done, but each generation of them seems to get more smart.

The snarky boy from before leaves his 'friend' alone with a smirk on his face. The boy looks sad,
and walks inside the house she was sitting on.

The boy shuts the front door behind him, He sighed heavily and walked up the foyer stairs to his
room. The inside of his home was cozy, but eerily silent, not a sound in the house. The parents
of the boy, highly trusting of their son, left the boy alone for a month on a cruise. The boy was
responsible enough to look after himself and the house, and was fine with being left alone.
But after a while, they boy started to miss his parents. He had very few friends, and the boy was
lonely. The boy made it up the stairs to his bedroom. Not bothering with the door, he collapsed
on his bed and buried his face into one of his pillows.

The boy suddenly burst into tears, a steady flow of water staining the soft fabric of his pillow.
The snarky boy from before was his neighbor, and one of the boys few friends. They had known
each other since they were toddlers, and has always been good friends. But after he had
received his first Pokemon and had become a trainer, he became arrogant, and started to make
fun of the boy.

Today, the boy was feeling extra sensitive, after getting a scolding from the teacher at school
today. And when his 'friend' made a hurtful jab at him, it was too much.

Out of the blue there was a slight rapping at the bedroom window sill. The boy turned his head,
but saw nothing outside. Curious, he sniffled, rubbed the tears from his eyes, and walked to the
glass. He pushed the latch off and opened the window, but there still was nothing outside.

"Mew~"

The boy jumped in surprise and nearly hit his head against the top of the window frame. He
quickly turned around to see what made the sudden noise. And then he froze.
In front of the boy was a Pokemon. Not just any Pokemon, however. Hovering in the air not 4
feet away from him, was Mew. The playful thing giggled at the boy before doing a few swoops in
the air around him. The Boy thought that he was dreaming, there was no absolute way that THE
Mew was in his house, in his room, with him! But all thoughts of doubt were silenced at the pink
kitten suddenly got up in his face and licked his nose. The boy gushed and stifled a laugh, but
not very well.

Mew smiled as the boy laughed. She loved lifting people's spirits. The kitten nuzzled the boys
chest affectionate, making the boy blush even further. Humans always liked it when they got to
cuddle with her.

"I-I-I-I can't believe It...It's really you..." the boy breathed. He suddenly found his balance out of
whack and his legs feeling numb. He rested against the wall and let his body slide down to the
floor, holding Mew against him. She was so soft to the touch, the boy swore his heart melted as
one of her playful paws kicked up against his neck.

The boy did not know why she was ere, or why she chose him of all people to let him see her,
and even hold her!m But it didn't matter, either Mew or the Boy wanted to move for a very
long while, happy and content with just their embrace alone.
That's when Mew broke the silence with her tummy.

GRROOWLLL

Mew's stomach violently shook against the boy's chest. He was surprised such a small thing
could make so much noise! Mew was not so much surprised, as she was embarrassed. She
blushed and offered a sheepish grin t o the boy, slowly rubbing her lithe belly.

Mustering up all the courage he had in his body, the boy decided to actually talk to mew and not
just stare at her. "Would you...like something to eat?" the boy asked softly, not wanting to sound
intrusive and drive the Legendary away. Mew looked up at the boy in surprise, and a smile
slowly formed on her face. She brought her hands up in the air to signify her approval, looking
very cute doing it.

The Boy chuckled, got up on his feet, still holding the small kitty, and started to walk downstairs.
He was already feeling better.

Mew laid back into the Boy's chest and let out a sigh. She was happy she came down to this
village. Not only was she getting a free meal, but she also helped someone feel happy, and that
is all that really matters.

The boy walked into the kitchen and set Mew down on the good seat so she would be comfy. He
had memorized every recipe in the cookbook and was happy to cook for someone. He always
wanted to be a chef more than a trainer. His parents never really understood why, and for some
reason was in outright denial when he brought it up. The boy supposed that all parents want
their kids to be trainers.

The whipped up a few homemade pancakes quickly, and set the plate in front of Mew. The
psychic cat eyed the dish curiously. It was obviously bigger than herself in both width and
height. She had seen the Humans eat this before but she had never herself. The boy noticed
her hesitation and instantly became worried.

"What's wrong? Do you not like it? I'll make something else for you if that's what you want." The
boy offered generously. Mew shook her head, not wanting to be rude. Eventually, Mew took a
deep breath a took a small bit from the fluffy rises of dough and syrup.

And then she took another.

And then another.

And another.

And another.

Mew was eating the plate so fast she had barely enough time to realize what she was doing.
She had never tasted anything like this in her whole life, anything this delicious! She just
shoveled bit after bit into her maw, wanting--no, needing more. And before she know it there
was nothing left on the plate to eat.

The boy stood amazed as he pieced together what just happened. He had never seen anyone,
much less a Pokemon, eat that fast. Mew's stomach, once small and only a little puffy, was now
distended into a perfect sphere that was bigger then her body. Mew rubbed her gut softly,
enjoying this new sensation.
1411111.title: Mew

14111111.content:
The massive intake of food did not come without immediate effects, however. The contents
within Mew’s stomach was eagerly digested, happily processing the food into nutrients. Soon,
Mew’s over inflated gut slowly deflated, but other parts of her body, however, were rising like
dough from an oven.

Mew’s eyes drooped as a pleasant sensation of warmth unexpectedly filled her body. She was
not paying attention to her body at the time and simply mewed softly as a sense of sleepiness
overcame her.

The boy watched in amazement as the creature in front of him slowly but steadily grew outward
and upwards. The sleepy legendary’s rear end slowly formed into a sizable little bubble butt,
slightly enveloping her thickened tail that swished from side to side on the countertop. Mew’s
thighs, already slightly pronounced, now jutted out from her frame considerably, warm jiggling
fat supporting her hind quarters.

Her stomach had stopped shrinking, but was now replaced with a spherical pot belly tah rested
on her lap. Her legs and arms had puffed up as well, once rail thin, now had a healthy layer of
padding. Mew’s chin slowly turned into a double chin, and her cheeks bulged out like a
Watchdog.

Mew didn't seem to notice the gain, surprisingly. She was far too tired to recognize what was
happening around her at the moment. She was starting to regret eating all that food at once.
She gave out a small burp, and fell back onto the cool, slick tiled surface.

The boy stood motionless for a few moments before attempting to pick up the sleeping Mew. He
had not expected anything like that to happen when she ate his food. But at the very least, she
appeared to like it, or dare he say, love it from how fast she ate it! As soon as he picked her up,
he noted another difference that he did not notice before.

Before, the boy was able to cradle the small cat in his arms very easily, considering she was
roughly the size of his chest. But now...it seemed to the boy that Mew grew! It wasn't much,
probably only 4 inches, but it was still noticeable.

The boy also took into account how much more soft and cute Mew was now. She was already
insanely cuddly with her super-fine fur, but her added pudge gave her an extra squish and
warmth that she hadn't had before. Her cute faci features, to the boy, had only increased in
factors of adorableness, her bloated cheeks and chins only amplifying it.

The Boy looked down Mew sleeping in his arms with a warm smile. It felt nice to have her be so
close to him, to have someone to care for. The Boy walked out of the kitchen with Mew still in
his arms. As he traversed the staircase back up to his room, mew tossed and turned against his
chest, trying to get comfortable.

“You really are cute, you know that?” the boy hugged the sleeping Pokemon to his chest. “You
just make me want to hug you forever and never let go.”.

Mew said nothing in response, but in her nap she buried her head into the Boy’s chest, as if she
could hear him and she was signifying the feelings were mutual. The Boy made it up to the flight
of stairs and entered his room.

The boy walked over to his bed and pried Mew from off of his chest. He set the cute little thing
underneath the covers of his bed and tucked them over her small, but fat body, sending her into
further warmth and sleep. The Boy smiled and left his room as to not disturb his new guest. He
had homework to do and he was more then happy to do it outside his room.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------
Later that night…
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------
Mew woke up in the middle of the night at the young human's house. She felt rejuvenated and
refreshed as she stretched her pudgy arms over her head. She craned her neck from side to
side to get out any pesky thoughts of sleep. She looked around and realized that she had gone
to sleep in the boy's bed. How sweet of him to offer his room to her she thought.

It was then that mew finally realized the results of her overeating many hours ago. She saw her
fattened stomach and poked at it puzzlingly, not knowing where it had come from. It quivered in
response, erupting a giggle from the legendary. She also noticed that she was significantly taller
than before,and her limbs and rear end had thickened up as well. She swished her newly
fattened tail around the bed sheets before wrapping it around herself.

Mew decided that the changes were unexpected, but not unwelcome. Besides, the more there
is of her, the more there is to love, right? That's what the humans have always said anyway.
She hopped off the bed and levitated into the air. She was about to fly out the window, before
looking back at the bedroom door. Surely, she could spend one minute to see the boy one last
time, couldn't she?

She teleported herself into the downstairs living room and saw the boy. He had gone to sleep on
the couch and was wrapped up in a blanket. Mew smiled warmly, grateful that the boy gave her
such soft sleeping arrangements at the expense of his comfort. She noticed there was
something on the coffee table that caught Mew's eye. It was a red velvet cupcake with a note
leaning against it. Mew levitated the note up to her and read it.

"Dear Mew,

Thank you for cheering me up today. I really needed it. I hope that i will one day see you again.
Signed, Stan.

P.S I made a cupcake for you if you want It. You like my food so much earlier, I thought you
might want some more."

Mew remarked on how she spent all this time with the boy without knowing his name. Stan,
huh? Not the name she would have picked, but a names a name, she guessed. She returned
her stare to the cupcake, eagerly awaiting for someone to eat it. Mew reasoned that it would be
rude to eat the cupcake. She didn't want to give the impression the Bo--Stan was a bad host.
She floated down to the coffee table and started digging into the dessert greedily. This dish she
was familiar with, and she remembered the taste with glee. She guzzled down the frosting, not
leaving a single ounce of it smeared on her cheeks. By the time she was finished with the top,
she was already sucking down the chocolate filling. She munched into the sides of the cupcake
with happiness, and in a few more seconds there was nothing left but a single measly crumb.
Mew belched softly and blushed hard, happy that there was no one around to see her make
such a Tepig out of her self. He belly had once again inflated to insane amount, but she didn't
feel tired like before. Rather, her stomach was anticipating such a large meal and was using a
lot less energy to convert int into proper nutrients.
14111111.title: Mew Starts to Put on the Pounds

choices: It's been fun. but Mew really has to go
Mew stays just a while longer
141111111.content:
Mew hovered herself onto the couch next to Stan’s sleeping form. She felt heavy and wanted to
sit down before she headed out. She was careful not to make a sound as to not wake him up,
but as she was getting comfortable in the couch’s cushions, she accidentally kicked her large
paws into his body. Not enough to hurt of course, but enough to wake up a human.

Stan fluttered his eyes open and sat up groggily, not particularly happy to have been woken up
in the middle of the night. He surveyed his surroundings for what woke him up, and his eyes
eventually fell on Mew, with a rather guilty look on her face, sitting next to him. “Oh,” Stan eased
up, “Hello Mew, is there something you needed?” he asked innocently.

Mew was about to shake her head to decline her generous host, but she was interrupted by a
very low and steady noise.

‘Grrrrwwrrll…’

Mew blushed as red as roses as she realized it was her stomach. What was going on with her?
She never gets hungry like this. Usually she just keeps it under control by using her psychic
abilities and only releases them when she want’s to indulge. But this wasn't natural hunger, this
was...want. Want to the point her body is telling her she needs food.

Stan noticed Mew’s expression and her belly rumbling. He chuckled softly and got off the couch.
He carefully reached out for mew to hop into his arms and she obliged, letting him carry her.
Stan remained silent and walked to the kitchen, much to Mew’s confusion.

“Mew,” Stan started after a relatively long silence. They had entered the kitchen and stan had
set Mew down on the countertop. “If you want I...what I mean is...I noticed you were still hungry
and I…”

He paused and fumbled with his mouth, trying to get the words to formulate. Mew noticed a
extra shade of colour appearing on his cheeks. “Well I Like cooking.. I-I-I like cooking for you.”
Mew tilted her head, puzzled.

Stan took a deep breath and turned to the refrigerator, opening It. “It’s just that...when you're
around, and when I was making food for you…I felt needed. I like feeling needed. My parents
like to do everything for me and they never let me return the favor. But when I’m with you...I feel
weird. A good weird I think.”

Mew eventually understands what Stan is saying and smiles warmly at him. She hovered
herself in the air and stealthily crept her way behind Stan. “What I’m trying to say is,” he turned
around, but as he was about to say something he was interrupted the very cute and pudgy Mew
right in front of his face. She grinned and planted a tiny little kiss on his forehead, silencing him.
Stan and Mew stared at each other in silence, both unmoving, unblinking. Some people might
call what they were doing “An uncomfortable silence”, but in truth, only Stan was uncomfortable.
Mew was rather enjoying herself. And she had a nagging suspicion she was going to enjoy
herself even more soon.

And in one moment, in one tiny nanosecond of a moment, Stan thought he heard someone
speak to him in his head. A feminine, rather high pitched voice. Mew was speaking to him
telepathically, and it was the first time he ever heard her actually talk besides saying ‘Mew’.

I'm hungry, please feed me.

Mew gave an almost sultry look and hovered herself back to the counter, opening her mouth
expectantly to the blushing boy. The young human blushed beyond red, and quickly turned
himself back around and grabbed some foodstuffs from the fridge.

Mew’s stomach roared in impatience as it voiced it’s disapproval for having to wait so long. Mew
smacked her belly as an attempt to scold it, but all that amounted to was sending waves of
blubber bob along her body, making it gurgle louder.

Stan wasted no time in grabbing a grabbing food. He carried from the fridge to the counter
chocolate chip cookies, marshmallow puffs, a full carton of pudding, a carton a chocolate
MooMoo Milk, 2 giant jars of pickles, and last but not least, a beautiful cake! Mew’s eyes
widened in excitement as all the food was laid out of front of her. It was if someone had turned a
light inside her body.


Impossible to contain her excitement, Mew dove into the food without a second thought, or
without giving Stan the chance to actually feed her. She started with the cake and tore great,
big chunks out it with her small paws and cramming them her greedy gullet. She decided to
wash down the cake and fattening butter cream icing with some chocolate milk, drinking the
whole bottle dry and made sure not to leave a single droplet.


And as she glutted and chomped and feasted, she grew. Her belly just exploded as the food
digested into smooth, cuddly flab. In a minute it was too big for her haunches and cascaded
down into the tiled surface. Her rear end and thighs evolved from a cute bubble butt to
downright beach balls in comparison to her little body. Chins upon runs from ned on her face
and neck as her cheeks blobbed out from her face. Mew laughed happily as the fool told tickled
her warm belly.


And as she got fatter and fatter, she also got taller. Stan watched the rapidly ballooning mew
take up more surface area. Her huge feet got even more huge and were making tiny spider
cracks in the tile under her increasing weight. The flow of growth made her go from being a
small foot and a half tall to 2 feet. Then 3 feet…then 4 feet….


Stan watched with a mix of fear and awe. Fear because he was concerned if what was
happening to mew was healthy, and awe because he rather enjoyed swing her so happy. And
by the rim she finished all the fox that he had bright to her, mew was, to put it lightly, huge.
No longer the tiny little kitten that she was before, Mew had grown to just under Stan’s height,
an impressive 5.5 ft! She was also much, much more heavy then she was before she started
eating, once just a meager 8 lbs, now she was a whopping 200! Perhaps even more! She took
up the entire space of the counter top with her form alone, letting her blubber slightly droop
along the edges.


Mew smiled goofy and rubbed a single paw against her very large and puffy gut, enjoying how
soft and warm it was. Stan stood in shock, surprised at how fast Mew grew in such a short
amount of time, before tentatively placing his left hand on her stomach as well. He ran his
fingers against her oh so soft fur and smiled was Mew let out a happy cry, obviously enjoying
what he was doing/


Suddenly, both of them heard a strange rattling sound underneath Mew. Stan looked down to
see cracks branching down from the top of the counter down to the floor, chips of it starting to fly
off. Before he could react, Mew me weight proved to be too much for the poor piece of furniture
and it fell apart, along with mew, to the floor.


“Mew!” Stan exclaimed as Mew landed on the ground with a heavy thud. “Are you alright!?” He
asked, but it came out more like a shout he was so scared. Mew replied with a cough as the
dust settled around yet and she rubbed her head as though it had hit something. Stan got on his
knees and began to inspect the fallen legendary. She seemed fine, but he was still worried.


“Are you sure you're not hurt? Nothing out of place?” He Asked frantically. Mew waved her paw
in a dismissing notion, her arm flab shaking and giggling madly. She then began to stand up,
with some help from Stan as support. It was a bit surreal to the human child to see Mew, who
earlier this day was able to fit in his arms, now came up to his chest.


Mew smiled up at Stan and gave him and wrapped her pudgy arms and tail around him in a
hug. Stan was surprised at first, but eased himself into it, slowly returning the hig. He figured
that this was how she was showing thanks for helping feed her.


‘Grrrrrooowlll…’


Both Stan and Mew shot their eyes opened in surprise and looked down t her bloated stomach.
Despite eating enough food to last a family for three days, she was still hungry! Mew blushed
and looked back up to Stan with wanting, maybe needing eyes. Stan slowly smiled warmly and
patted Mew on the head.


“Still hungry, huh?”

“Mew…”

“I think there's still some food left in the fridge.”
