141122112.title: The Creation Trio

1411221121.content:
A great bright light flashes in the woodlands near Pallet Town.

A portal made composed of a divine energy opens up in front of a shallow pond. Out from the portal steps out Arceus, the creator Alpha Pokemon.

As Arceus's body fully entered the forest clearing, the Portal behind him closed shut, making a thunderclap that echoed across the forest. Arceus knelt at the shore of the pond and bent his neck down to take a relaxing drink.

You see, this particular pond was of very special interest to the Alpha Pokemon. It was one of the only bodies of water that human hands or Pokemon had not touched, his own personal drinking supply.

Once Arceus had his fill of water, he stood up straight and began to wade through the shallow pool. He sat down on his rear and dunked his head in the water, enjoying the plesant coolness washing over him. After a couple of seconds he brought his head back up, letting refreshing water trickle down his neck.

"Sigh..." Arceus sighed in content and closed his eyes. Being father of the Legendaries is no walk in the park. Always quarreling over petty arguments while putting a bunch of innocents in risk. He needed to get away from them once in a couple centuries to relax.

Just a couple of months ago, Palkia and Dialga tried to kill each other over something as childish as 'who's better', and a town got stuck in the middle of them and almost got destroyed! If it wasent for the Chosen one, then that poor town would have...

"Ash..." Arceus whined to herself. "Why can't I stop thinking about you?"

It was true. Ever since Ash saved him from hurting all those people Michina Town, he had been spying on his life from time to time to "check up on him". For some reason, Ash had made an impression on Arceus. His nobility and courage in face of impossible odds was rare in Humans, and most Pokemon.

But the biggest reason Ash attracted Arceus's attention was his happiness. He saved the world like, fourteen times, and he always had a smile on his face while doing it. Joy was a...distant emotion to Atceus. It's not that he's unhappy, he just doesn't have many likes or wants. Sometimes he wishes that he could just talk to him and ask him what being happy likes, but he couldent do that, he's the God Pokemon, he has to keep up an appearance of-

Arceus's train of thought was cut short as he heard something rustle in the bushes nearby. His head shot straight up and glared in the direction of the noise.

"Whoever is there," Arceus snarled, "Show yourself, or else."

An awkward silence fills the air of the shallow pool. Arceus's gaze never left the bushes as he waited for an awnser. Finnaly, a human hand appears out from behind the foliage, using a nearby tree as a support to get up. Soon, the rest of the body came into view.

"A...Ash?"

Out from behind the bushes came Ash Ketchum, the hero from Pallet Town and Arceus's Chosen one. He had his hand on his head, grinning nervously like a kid getting caught with the hand in the cookie jar. "Uhhh...hey Arceus. How you uh...how ya doin?"

Arceus looked down at Ash with...
1411221121.title: Arceus

14112211212.content:
Arceus's eyes relaxed and his 'mouth' curved into a content grin.

"'Giggle', I'm doing fine Ash. But what are you doing here?" He asked gently.

"Oh! I...um...I was taking a walk in the forest when I heard a Big Bang, and I thought someone was hurt." Ash shuffled his legs uneasily "But I didn't think that I would ever find...you".

Arceus grinned a little bit more. He started to wade across the shallow pond towards Ash. Ash stared agape as Arceus's shadow eclipsed him as the God Pokemon stood over his head.

Seeing his face like that made Arceus chuckle.

"Ash," Arceus said working up the nerve to speak to him, "As long as your here, do you mind if we have a little...talk?"

"Uhhhmm" Ash froze up. You would think after spending so much time with legendaries he would be used to talking to them. "...sure?"

Arceus almost burst out lapping seeing Ash's reaction, but manged to suppress it. Suddenly Arceus began to glow. It was subtle at first, but soon he grew so bright that Ash had to cover his eyes. When the light subsided, Ash opened his eyes to an amusing sight.

Arceus was no longer the towering giant he was before. Now, Arceus was at the height of a little bit over a sawsbuck, not as tall as he was before by a long shot, but still was taller than Ash.

"W-why did you d-d-do that Arceus?" Ash stuttered.

Arceus tilted his head on his side and smiled. "I thought that shrinking down to a less imposing level would be more comfortable for you...Unless of course you would like me to change back."

"NO!" Ash shouted. "I mean 'clears throat' no, uh, I like you better this way. I MEAN, not that I didn't like you before I just-"

Arceus cut Ash's amusing rambling short by bringing up a hoof to his face in a improvised shushing way. Ash immediately fell silent. Arceus then gestured Ash to sit dos on the grass, which he did without hesitation. Arceus walked over to where he was sitting and popped his rear down next to him.

"So, what did you want to talk about Arceus?" Ash said, regaining his composure.

"Well" Arceus started to blush, "this is a rather silly question. But...Ash...what makes you happy?"

"...huh?"

"Happiness is...very foreign to me." Arceus explained. "And I want to understand what being happy feels like, and how you cause it. So, to reiterate, what makes you happy Ash?"

Ash felt a twinge of sadness for Arceus. Doesn't know happiness? That's no way to live!

"Well, being with my friends always puts a smile on my face!" Ash exclaimed.

"Friends?"

"Yup!"

"...is there...anything else? I'm not too good at making friends."

Ash felt seven more sad for Arceus now. "Well, I feel good after eating a good meal, but I doubt that you-"

"You mean food?" Arceus suddenly shot up. "Food makes you happy?"

"In a way I guess." Ash reached into his backpack he was carrying and pulled out a little cupcake.

"My mom packed me lunch in case I would stay out here longer than I planned. Would you like some?" Ash held out his hand offering the cupcake.

Arceus inspected the pastry curiously. It looked decent enough. And it would be incredibly rude to turn down an offer from the chosen one. 'Eh, why not?' Arceus thought to himself. He gave his equivalent of a shrug since he doesn't have shoulders, and took a bite out the cupcake from Ashs hand.

Arceus's eyes dilated.

His whole body froze up.

His mouth started to drool.

Ash started to worry that there was something wrong. "Arceus are you okay?"

Arceus responded only by swallowing the cupcake bite with an audible gulp. He stayed frozen for a couple more seconds, before he clamped his mouth shut on the rest of the cupcake with Ashs hand with it.

"GAH! Arceus what are you doing." Ash Screamned, not expecting this at all.

Arceus swallowed the rest of the cupcake and started to moan with pleasure His body wiggled with joy as he felt the sweet pastry travel down his through the info his belly. He sat down on the ground dragging Ash with him into his torso. After he stopped shivering he finnaly released Ashs hand, covered in saliva.

"That...was...PERFECT!"

"PERFECT?" Ash questioned. "Arceus are you okay?"

Then, much to Ash's surprise, Arceus quickly wrapped his two front legs around him, embracing him in a hug. Ash blushed tomatoe red. The first thing Ash's mind registered was how SOFT Arceus's fur pelt was. The second thing was 'why is the most powerful Pokemon hugging me?'

"Oh Ash," seemingly reading his mind. "Thank you soooo much. I haven't felt such emotions in Centuries." Arceus's voice had lost his formality and you could her euphoria dripping off it. "You were right, Food DOES make you happy." Arceus rested his head on Ash, knocking off his hat.

Ash was now blushing profusely. Reviving such attention and affection from Arceus made his body go numb, and he couldent tell whether this was a weird experiance or a good one.

Suddenly, Arceus's stomach, reacting from eating something after thousands of years, gurgled so loudly that Ash was shook violently up and down. Arceus released his right limb off ash and poked his belly curiously, prompting another gurgle. Arceus giggled.

"Looks like I still want more food." Arceus giggled. Arceus's eyes were set on...
14112211212.title: Affection

choices: A small ball of flab popped out.
A giant wave of flab billows out.
141122112121.content:
Arceus set his gaze on Ash's backpack. He rolled his tongue over his metallic muzzle.

He suddenly sprang up from the ground and pranced like a Deerling to the backpack with a hungry look in his eyes...lightly trampeling Ash under his hooves.

"OW! Arceus! What are yo-'GURK!' Hey!" Ash cried in pain as Arceus planted his foot, unintentionally, in his mouth. Arceus either paid him no heed or couldent hear him.

Arceus jumped up into the air, hung still for a moment, and crashed down back to earth onto of the backpack, like a predator would keep its pray from running away. And like a predator, Arceus dove his head into the satchel and started scarfing down anything edible. Apparently, Delia had packed Ash a whole dozen cupcakes, thinking that he might want to feed the local Pokemon.

Well, in a way the cupcakes served there purpose, but Arceus isn't really what you call a local Pokemon. But he didn't care about who they were for, he just wanted to eat.

Arceus quickly dove into the cupcakes, smearing pink icing on his metal cheeks. He ate with a speed that was unnatural even for him, and in no time at all, the pastries were no more. Another chill of intends pleasure filled Arceus's body.

'I've never felt like this before' Arceus thought to himself. 'Is this feeling...happiness?'

'The intence sensation as it dances across your tongue, the feeling of it working dos your throat, the fullness you get in your stomach...' Arceus almost fell into another food coma, before his gut brought back his attention.

GUURRGGLE

The noise surprised Arceus. It was foreign to him, since he never eaten food before. But guessing from what he pieced together by spying on humans, he assumed that the noise was hunger. And hunger is a mortal thing your stomach does when it needs more food. So, much to Arceus's pleasure, he resumed eating from Ash's sack to stop feeling hunger.

All the time he was glutting, Ash looked from afar and saw the legendary alpha Pokemon raid is backpack.

'Maybe I shouldn't have given him that cupcake.' Ash mused. He may be a bit dense, but he could tell that Arceus was acting very different. Usually, he's all serious and intimadating, but now...

...it's like there's this newfound joy in him. Like a kid almost. He was now light on his feet where before he would somberly march. He's...giddy. It kinda made him look cute in Ash's opinion. So cute, that he was having a hard time be mad at him for trampling on him like a herd of bouffalant and raid his backpack.

Ash kept staring at Arceus's display of gluttony. After a couple minutes, he either was full, or ran out of food, because Arceus finnaly raised his head from Ash's now entirely devoid of food sack.

Crumbs were plastered on Arceus's smiling face. He sat dow on his haunches and closed his eyes, like he was meditating or something. Ash cautiously approached Arceus, not wanting to get glomped on again, even if it did feel nice.

Suddenly, Arceus's eyes shot wide open, but this time, ash could see that there was something other than joy behind it.

Pain

"AAAARRRGGH!" Arceus Screamned in pain, a streak a hot water streaming from his eyes. Ash rushed to his side, trying to figure out what's wrong.

"Arceus? What happened?! Are you okay?!" That was a stupid question ash thought to himself, if course he's in pain!

"Grrf...my...stomach...."

'Oh no' ash thought, 'It must have been something he ate'

"Ash.. " Arceus wheezed, "there is a...latch on my..plate wheel." He must have meant the ring that surrounded his body Ash thought.

"Release it...please."

"But why?"

Ash didn't get an awnser. Instead he received another contorted look of misery from Arceus as another wave of pain hit him. Although he was still confused, he got up from the ground and started to insoect the ring. He looked hard and long but he couldent find anything that looked loke a latch.

"It's...on my belly..." Arceus wheezed.

Ash got down on all fours and crawled in between his haunches. There, he found a veeeeery tiny little hatch on his wheel. He fumbled with it a bit, but he managed to release it.

1411222.title: So Sinnoh?

1412.content:
It was one of the sadder moments of life that was portrayed on the shores of Unova. A small pod of wailord, some of the largest living Pokemon that could be found had beached themselves and ultimately wound up perishing on the sandy shores. Rather or not they had been trying to aide the first trapped, fooled on to it by human sonars, or been desperate enough to risk shallows for food, one thing was certain. From the horrid scene of death, arose a nessecary of life for others. In their deaths, the enormous water types provided others with a life sustaining chance for food.

In theory at least, for some unknown reason the banquet of precious calories remained untouched by the usual scavengers of the Unovan coast. The mystery handing over the scene for a bit of time before it's answer was revealed. As trees were brushed aside and sudden drop of temperature could be felt, the frozen dragoness that was the Boundary Pokemon Kyurem arrived at the beach. Her mere presence scarring of the usual suspects.

However the sound of beating wings signaled the arrival of a not so typical visitor. Landing on his grey talons, the Rainbow Pokemon Ho-Oh arrived on scene. To the displeasure of the dragon who was less then pleased with the prospect of having to share in the bountiful feast. "What are you doing here, rainbow chicken." The female legend asked with a slight growl.

Undetected by the show of aggression. Undercut by the reason the two where here, louder growls from the empty bellies of both Pokemon. "I would imagine the same as you, hungry for a meal." Ho-Oh had paused in his flight at the chance of a meal, having just underwent the long flight from Johto to Unova. A wing was raised and waved over the scene, "Surely there is more then enough for is both to have our fill."

"Perhaps, am hungry. Can surely eat more then a bird." Granted Ho-Oh was even larger then her, but the younger legend was not to keen on the idea of having to share. Excess of food aside.

The slightly older Pokemon however appeared to know how to deal with his unruly dinner date. "Care to place a wager on it?" Almost as swiftly as the challenge had been raised was it accepted. Meals secured the duo went to opposite ends of the feast and dug in with beaks and fangs. Feathers and scales stained red as the duo raced in their display of gluttony.
